front.title: An introduction to privacy engineering and risk management in federal systems

author.organization: Information Technology Laboratory (National Institute of Standards and Technology)

front.abstract: This document provides an introduction to the concepts of privacy engineering and risk management for federal information systems. These concepts establish the basis for a common vocabulary to facilitate better understanding and communication of privacy risk within federal information systems, and the effective implementation of privacy principles. This publication introduces two key components to support the application of privacy engineering and risk management: privacy engineering objectives and a privacy risk model.
